CatDescriptText: Beatrice Tucker, maid, 2171 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 7, 1959, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think that the Wacs and others women's units, with the exception of nurses, should be abolished in armed services during peacetime? Why?" answer reads: "I think that the children today have their way over the parents who don't do much to prevent this attitude.  The things which the kids do today, I could not get away with when I was growing up."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Beatrice Tucker wearing dark herringbone coat with rounded collar and brooch, carrying paper bag, standing in front of flecked stone wall with curtained window, buildings in background
